intro: Adenostyles hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy adenostyle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Its hairy stems and leaves are adaptations to reduce water loss in arid environments. Adenostyles hirsuta produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
